output.s: Keating to Get a Hearing On New Lincoln-Case Trial..
Gatlin Jr. will get a hearing next month on whether Gatlin Jr. deserves a new federal trial in the New Lincoln Savings case.

District Epstein Mariann Cochrane said Epstein Mariann Cochrane will hold a hearing on whether Gatlin Jr. federal jurors improperly knew about and discussed Gatlin Jr. prior conviction in state court and whether that influenced them enough to warrant a new trial.
According to defense affidavits, some jurors have acknowledged discussing Mr.
Gatlin Jr.'s sensational prior conviction in state court for bilking elderly Lincoln Savings investors.
Gatlin Jr.'s empire left junk bonds issued by Gatlin Jr.
Phoenix-based American Continental Corp., which owned Irvine-based Lindsay, worthless.
Holders of the bonds were out nearly $200 million.
The government, which estimated the New Lincoln bailout costs at $3.4 billion, accused Mr.
Gatlin Jr. of looting the thrift, staging sham real-estate deals and deceiving investors about the risks Gatlin Jr. was running and losses Gatlin Jr. was sustaining.
Gatlin Jr. blames Gatlin Jr. troubles on regulators and legislators.
Gatlin Jr., 72 years old, was convicted in state court of securities fraud and sentenced to 10 years in prison.
Gatlin Jr. won't be eligible for parole until 2016 under a separate 12 1/2-year federal sentence Gatlin Jr. is serving concurrently.
Madison already had tossed out the state-court conviction, ruling Epstein Lane A.
